meanings.definition: A frame in an animation or video that serves as a reference point for the beginning or end of a transition or effect.
meanings.sent1: In the animation, the keyframe marked the start of the character's movement.
meanings.sent2: The keyframe at the end of the scene helped smoothly transition to the next one.
meanings.sent3: The keyframe decided to take a break and pause the action for a moment.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a keyframe, signaling the shift from sadness to joy.
meanings.sent5: The keyframe stood out like a bright beacon, guiding the viewer's focus.

meanings.definition: A frame in computer graphics that defines the starting or ending point of an animation sequence.
meanings.sent1: The keyframe set the initial pose for the 3D model.
meanings.sent2: Without the keyframe, the animation would not have a clear starting point.
meanings.sent3: The keyframe decided to play hide-and-seek with the other frames.
meanings.sent4: His smile was the keyframe of the whole presentation, capturing everyone's attention.
meanings.sent5: The keyframe acted as a gatekeeper, controlling the flow of the animation.

meanings.definition: A frame in digital editing software that marks a specific point in time for a change in an attribute or effect.
meanings.sent1: By adjusting the keyframe, the color of the image shifted seamlessly.
meanings.sent2: The keyframe indicated where the special effect should begin.
meanings.sent3: The keyframe decided to throw a surprise party for the other frames.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was the keyframe that transformed the entire project.
meanings.sent5: The keyframe functioned like a time traveler, altering the course of the video.
